column1: Plague is a severe and potentially deadly bacterial infection.
Plague is caused by the bacteria Yersinia pestis.
Rodents such as rats carry the disease.

The three most common forms of plague are: - Bubonic plague, an infection of the lymph nodes - Pneumonic plague, an infection of the lungs - Septicemic plague, an infection of the blood The time between being infected and developing symptoms is typically 2 to 8 days.
